DOC.brief_summary: This study compare effectiveness two type cognitive behavioral therapy treat adult woman dysregulated subtype bulimia nervosa .
DOC.brief_title: Focused Versus Enhanced Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Treating Women With Bulimia Nervosa
DOC.detailed_description: Bulimia nervosa ( BN ) common eat disorder characterize period binge purging . People dysregulated subtype BN experience behavioral impulsivity ; disruption cognitive , affective , behavioral , neurophysiological process ( dysregulation ) ; interpersonal dysfunction ; poor treatment response . To date , therapy test specific population , unknown whether therapy directly focus treat BN symptom one address eat personality disorder symptom effective . Cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) , concentrate modify patient ' behavior way think , effective treating BN . This study compare effectiveness two type CBT , focus broad , treat adult woman dysregulated subtype BN . Participants single-blind study randomly assign receive 20 session either broad ( enhance ) focus CBT . Participants meet therapist twice weekly 20 session occur . Broad CBT address symptom BN , well personality disorder . Focused CBT concentrate BN symptom . Before treatment begin , participant complete set questionnaire pertain experience BN , depression , anxiety , interpersonal relationship . The questionnaire use throughout study assess participant ' progress . Participants also attend clinical interview last approximately 3.5 hour . Questions concern BN , eat disorder symptom , depression , anxiety , interpersonal relationship . Blood sample vital sign also take time clinical interview need later treatment process .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis bulimia nervosa Presence borderline personality disorder feature History one mood anxiety episode within 2 year prior study entry If take psychiatric medication , dose stable least 6 week time study entry Substance dependence Diagnosis bipolar I disorder Psychosis Mental retardation Receiving psychosocial treatment
